trans-unit.source: Create Azure BizTalk Services in the Azure portal | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Create Azure BizTalk Services in the Azure portal | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to provision or create Azure BizTalk Services in the Azure portal; MABS, WABS
trans-unit.target: Learn how to provision or create Azure BizTalk Services in the Azure portal; MABS, WABS

trans-unit.source: This article shows how to create Azure BizTalk Services in the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: This article shows how to create Azure BizTalk Services in the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: To sign in to the Azure portal, you need an Azure account and Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: To sign in to the Azure portal, you need an Azure account and Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account within a few minutes.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account within a few minutes.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Azure Free Trial</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Azure Free Trial</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Depending on the Edition you choose, not all BizTalk Service settings may be available.
trans-unit.target: Depending on the Edition you choose, not all BizTalk Service settings may be available.

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the <linkText>Azure portal</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the <linkText>Azure portal</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In the bottom navigation pane, select NEW: Select the New button
trans-unit.target: In the bottom navigation pane, select NEW: Select the New button

trans-unit.source: Select APP SERVICES > BIZTALK SERVICE > CUSTOM CREATE: Select BizTalk Service and select Custom Create
trans-unit.target: Select APP SERVICES > BIZTALK SERVICE > CUSTOM CREATE: Select BizTalk Service and select Custom Create

trans-unit.source: Enter the BizTalk Service settings:
trans-unit.target: Enter the BizTalk Service settings:

trans-unit.source: BizTalk service name
trans-unit.target: BizTalk service name

trans-unit.source: You can enter any name but be specific. Some examples include:
trans-unit.target: You can enter any name but be specific. Some examples include:

trans-unit.source: mycompany
trans-unit.target: mycompany

trans-unit.source: .biztalk.windows.net
trans-unit.target: .biztalk.windows.net

trans-unit.source: mycompanymyapplication
trans-unit.target: mycompanymyapplication

trans-unit.source: .biztalk.windows.net
trans-unit.target: .biztalk.windows.net

trans-unit.source: myapplication
trans-unit.target: myapplication

trans-unit.source: .biztalk.windows.net
trans-unit.target: .biztalk.windows.net

trans-unit.source: ".biztalk.windows.net" is automatically added to the name you enter. This creates a URL that is used to access your BizTalk Service, like
trans-unit.target: ".biztalk.windows.net" is automatically added to the name you enter. This creates a URL that is used to access your BizTalk Service, like

trans-unit.source: https://
trans-unit.target: https://

trans-unit.source: myapplication
trans-unit.target: myapplication

trans-unit.source: .biztalk.windows.net
trans-unit.target: .biztalk.windows.net

trans-unit.source: Edition
trans-unit.target: Edition

trans-unit.source: If you are in the testing/development phase, choose
trans-unit.target: If you are in the testing/development phase, choose

trans-unit.source: Developer
trans-unit.target: Developer

trans-unit.source: . If you are in the production phase, use the
trans-unit.target: . If you are in the production phase, use the

trans-unit.target: BizTalk Services: Editions Chart

trans-unit.target: to determine if

trans-unit.source: Premium
trans-unit.target: Premium

trans-unit.source: Standard
trans-unit.target: Standard

trans-unit.target: , or

trans-unit.target: Basic

trans-unit.source: is the correct choice for your business scenario.
trans-unit.target: is the correct choice for your business scenario.

trans-unit.source: Region
trans-unit.target: Region

trans-unit.source: Select the geographic region to host your BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: Select the geographic region to host your BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: Domain URL
trans-unit.target: Domain URL

trans-unit.source: Optional
trans-unit.target: Optional

trans-unit.source: . By default, the domain URL is
trans-unit.target: . By default, the domain URL is

trans-unit.source: YourBizTalkServiceName
trans-unit.target: YourBizTalkServiceName

trans-unit.source: .biztalk.windows.net. A custom domain can also be entered. For example, if your domain is
trans-unit.target: .biztalk.windows.net. A custom domain can also be entered. For example, if your domain is

trans-unit.source: contoso
trans-unit.target: contoso

trans-unit.source: , you can enter:
trans-unit.target: , you can enter:

trans-unit.source: MyCompany
trans-unit.target: MyCompany

trans-unit.source: .contoso.com
trans-unit.target: .contoso.com

trans-unit.source: MyCompanyMyApplication
trans-unit.target: MyCompanyMyApplication

trans-unit.source: .contoso.com
trans-unit.target: .contoso.com

trans-unit.source: MyApplication
trans-unit.target: MyApplication

trans-unit.source: .contoso.com
trans-unit.target: .contoso.com

trans-unit.source: YourBizTalkServiceName
trans-unit.target: YourBizTalkServiceName

trans-unit.source: .contoso.com
trans-unit.target: .contoso.com

trans-unit.source: Select the NEXT arrow.
trans-unit.target: Select the NEXT arrow.

trans-unit.source: Enter the Storage and Database Settings:
trans-unit.target: Enter the Storage and Database Settings:

trans-unit.source: Monitoring/Archiving storage account
trans-unit.target: Monitoring/Archiving storage account

trans-unit.source: Select an existing storage account or create a new storage account.
trans-unit.target: Select an existing storage account or create a new storage account.

trans-unit.source: If you create a new Storage account, enter the
trans-unit.target: If you create a new Storage account, enter the

trans-unit.source: Storage Account Name
trans-unit.target: Storage Account Name

trans-unit.source: Tracking database
trans-unit.target: Tracking database

trans-unit.source: If you use an existing Azure SQL Database, it cannot be used by another BizTalk Service. You need the login name and password entered when that Azure SQL Database Server was created.
trans-unit.target: If you use an existing Azure SQL Database, it cannot be used by another BizTalk Service. You need the login name and password entered when that Azure SQL Database Server was created.

trans-unit.source: TIP
trans-unit.target: TIP

trans-unit.source: Create the Tracking database and Monitoring/Archiving storage account in the same region as the BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: Create the Tracking database and Monitoring/Archiving storage account in the same region as the BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: Select the NEXT arrow.
trans-unit.target: Select the NEXT arrow.

trans-unit.source: Enter the Database settings:
trans-unit.target: Enter the Database settings:

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: Available when
trans-unit.target: Available when

trans-unit.source: Create a new SQL Database instance
trans-unit.target: Create a new SQL Database instance

trans-unit.source: is selected in the previous screen.
trans-unit.target: is selected in the previous screen.

trans-unit.source: Enter a SQL Database name to be used by your BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: Enter a SQL Database name to be used by your BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: Server
trans-unit.target: Server

trans-unit.source: Available when
trans-unit.target: Available when

trans-unit.source: Create a new SQL Database instance
trans-unit.target: Create a new SQL Database instance

trans-unit.source: is selected in the previous screen.
trans-unit.target: is selected in the previous screen.

trans-unit.source: Select an existing SQL Database Server or create a new SQL Database server.
trans-unit.target: Select an existing SQL Database Server or create a new SQL Database server.

trans-unit.source: Server login name
trans-unit.target: Server login name

trans-unit.source: Enter the login user name.
trans-unit.target: Enter the login user name.

trans-unit.source: Server login password
trans-unit.target: Server login password

trans-unit.source: Enter the login password.
trans-unit.target: Enter the login password.

trans-unit.source: Region
trans-unit.target: Region

trans-unit.source: Available when
trans-unit.target: Available when

trans-unit.source: Create a new SQL Database instance
trans-unit.target: Create a new SQL Database instance

trans-unit.source: is selected. Select the geographic region to host your SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: is selected. Select the geographic region to host your SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: Select the check mark to complete the wizard.
trans-unit.target: Select the check mark to complete the wizard.

trans-unit.source: The progress icon appears: <linkText>Progress icon displays when complete</linkText>
trans-unit.target: The progress icon appears: <linkText>Progress icon displays when complete</linkText>

trans-unit.source: When complete, the Azure BizTalk Service is created and ready for your applications.
trans-unit.target: When complete, the Azure BizTalk Service is created and ready for your applications.

trans-unit.source: The default settings are sufficient.
trans-unit.target: The default settings are sufficient.

trans-unit.source: If you want to change the default settings, select BIZTALK SERVICES in the left navigation pane, and then select your BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: If you want to change the default settings, select BIZTALK SERVICES in the left navigation pane, and then select your BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: Additional settings are displayed in the <linkText>Dashboard, Monitor, and Scale tabs</linkText><title></title> at the top.
trans-unit.target: Additional settings are displayed in the <linkText>Dashboard, Monitor, and Scale tabs</linkText><title></title> at the top.

trans-unit.source: Depending on the state of the BizTalk Service, there are some operations that cannot be completed.
trans-unit.target: Depending on the state of the BizTalk Service, there are some operations that cannot be completed.

trans-unit.source: For a list of these operations, go to <linkText>BizTalk Services State Chart</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For a list of these operations, go to <linkText>BizTalk Services State Chart</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Install the certificate on a local computer</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Install the certificate on a local computer</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add a production-ready certificate</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add a production-ready certificate</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Get the Access Control namespace</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Get the Access Control namespace</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: As part of BizTalk Service provisioning, a self-signed certificate is created and associated with your BizTalk Service subscription.
trans-unit.target: As part of BizTalk Service provisioning, a self-signed certificate is created and associated with your BizTalk Service subscription.

trans-unit.source: You must download this certificate and install it on computers from where you either deploy BizTalk Service applications or send messages to a BizTalk Service endpoint.
trans-unit.target: You must download this certificate and install it on computers from where you either deploy BizTalk Service applications or send messages to a BizTalk Service endpoint.

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the <linkText>Azure portal</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the <linkText>Azure portal</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Select BIZTALK SERVICES in the left navigation pane, and then select your BizTalk Service subscription.
trans-unit.target: Select BIZTALK SERVICES in the left navigation pane, and then select your BizTalk Service subscription.

trans-unit.source: Select the Dashboard tab.
trans-unit.target: Select the Dashboard tab.

trans-unit.source: Select Download SSL Certificate: Modify SSL Certificate
trans-unit.target: Select Download SSL Certificate: Modify SSL Certificate

trans-unit.source: Double-click the certificate and run through the wizard to install the certificate.
trans-unit.target: Double-click the certificate and run through the wizard to install the certificate.

trans-unit.source: Make sure you install the certificate under the Trusted Root Certificate Authorities store.
trans-unit.target: Make sure you install the certificate under the Trusted Root Certificate Authorities store.

trans-unit.source: The self-signed certificate that is automatically created when creating BizTalk Services is intended for use in development environments only.
trans-unit.target: The self-signed certificate that is automatically created when creating BizTalk Services is intended for use in development environments only.

trans-unit.source: For production scenarios, replace it with a production-ready certificate.
trans-unit.target: For production scenarios, replace it with a production-ready certificate.

trans-unit.source: On the Dashboard tab, select Update SSL Certificate.
trans-unit.target: On the Dashboard tab, select Update SSL Certificate.

trans-unit.source: Browse to your private SSL certificate (CertificateName.pfx) that includes your BizTalk Service name, enter the password, and then click the check mark.
trans-unit.target: Browse to your private SSL certificate (CertificateName.pfx) that includes your BizTalk Service name, enter the password, and then click the check mark.

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the <linkText>Azure portal</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the <linkText>Azure portal</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Select BIZTALK SERVICES in the left navigation pane, and then select your BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: Select BIZTALK SERVICES in the left navigation pane, and then select your BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: In the task bar, select Connection Information: Select Connection Information
trans-unit.target: In the task bar, select Connection Information: Select Connection Information

trans-unit.source: Copy the Access Control values.
trans-unit.target: Copy the Access Control values.

trans-unit.source: When you deploy a BizTalk Service project from Visual Studio, you enter this Access Control namespace.
trans-unit.target: When you deploy a BizTalk Service project from Visual Studio, you enter this Access Control namespace.

trans-unit.source: The Access Control namespace is automatically created for your BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: The Access Control namespace is automatically created for your BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: The Access Control values can be used with any application.
trans-unit.target: The Access Control values can be used with any application.

trans-unit.source: When Azure BizTalk Services is created, this Access Control namespace controls the authentication with your BizTalk Service deployment.
trans-unit.target: When Azure BizTalk Services is created, this Access Control namespace controls the authentication with your BizTalk Service deployment.

trans-unit.source: If you want to change the subscription or manage the namespace, select ACTIVE DIRECTORY in the left navigation pane and then select your namespace.
trans-unit.target: If you want to change the subscription or manage the namespace, select ACTIVE DIRECTORY in the left navigation pane and then select your namespace.

trans-unit.source: The task bar lists your options.
trans-unit.target: The task bar lists your options.

trans-unit.source: Clicking Manage opens the Access Control Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: Clicking Manage opens the Access Control Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: In the Access Control Management Portal, the BizTalk Service uses Service identities: ACS Service Identities in the Access Control Management Portal
trans-unit.target: In the Access Control Management Portal, the BizTalk Service uses Service identities: ACS Service Identities in the Access Control Management Portal

trans-unit.source: The Access Control service identity is a set of credentials that allow applications or clients to authenticate directly with Access Control and receive a token.
trans-unit.target: The Access Control service identity is a set of credentials that allow applications or clients to authenticate directly with Access Control and receive a token.

trans-unit.source: The BizTalk Service uses Owner for the default service identity and the Password value.
trans-unit.target: The BizTalk Service uses Owner for the default service identity and the Password value.

trans-unit.source:
If you use the Symmetric Key value instead of the Password value, the following error may occur.

Could not connect to the Access Control Management Service account with the specified credentials
trans-unit.target:
If you use the Symmetric Key value instead of the Password value, the following error may occur.

Could not connect to the Access Control Management Service account with the specified credentials

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Managing Your ACS Namespace</linkText><title></title> lists some guidelines and recommendations.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Managing Your ACS Namespace</linkText><title></title> lists some guidelines and recommendations.

trans-unit.source: These requirements do not apply to the Free Edition.
trans-unit.target: These requirements do not apply to the Free Edition.

trans-unit.source: What you need
trans-unit.target: What you need

trans-unit.source: Why you need it
trans-unit.target: Why you need it

trans-unit.source: Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: The subscription determines who can sign in to the Azure portal. The Account holder creates the subscription at
trans-unit.target: The subscription determines who can sign in to the Azure portal. The Account holder creates the subscription at

trans-unit.source: Azure Subscriptions
trans-unit.target: Azure Subscriptions

trans-unit.source: The Azure account can have multiple subscriptions and can be managed by anyone who is permitted. For example, your Azure account holder creates a subscription named
trans-unit.target: The Azure account can have multiple subscriptions and can be managed by anyone who is permitted. For example, your Azure account holder creates a subscription named

trans-unit.source: BizTalkServiceSubscription
trans-unit.target: BizTalkServiceSubscription

trans-unit.source: and gives the BizTalk Administrators within your company (for example, ContosoBTSAdmins@live.com) access to this subscription. In this scenario, the BizTalk Administrators sign in to the Azure portal and have full Administrator rights to all the hosted services in the subscription, including Azure BizTalk Services. The BizTalk Administrators are not the Azure account holders and therefore don't have access to any billing information.
trans-unit.target: and gives the BizTalk Administrators within your company (for example, ContosoBTSAdmins@live.com) access to this subscription. In this scenario, the BizTalk Administrators sign in to the Azure portal and have full Administrator rights to all the hosted services in the subscription, including Azure BizTalk Services. The BizTalk Administrators are not the Azure account holders and therefore don't have access to any billing information.

trans-unit.source: Manage Subscriptions and Storage Accounts in the Azure portal
trans-unit.target: Manage Subscriptions and Storage Accounts in the Azure portal

trans-unit.source: provides more information.
trans-unit.target: provides more information.

trans-unit.source: Azure SQL Database
trans-unit.target: Azure SQL Database

trans-unit.source: Stores the tables, views, and stored procedures used by the BizTalk Service, including the Tracking data.
trans-unit.target: Stores the tables, views, and stored procedures used by the BizTalk Service, including the Tracking data.

trans-unit.source: When you create a BizTalk Service, you can use an existing Azure SQL Server, Azure SQL Database, or automatically create a new Server or Database.
trans-unit.target: When you create a BizTalk Service, you can use an existing Azure SQL Server, Azure SQL Database, or automatically create a new Server or Database.

trans-unit.source: The SQL Database scale is automatically configured. Typically, the default scale is sufficient for a BizTalk Service. Changing the scale impacts pricing. See
trans-unit.target: The SQL Database scale is automatically configured. Typically, the default scale is sufficient for a BizTalk Service. Changing the scale impacts pricing. See

trans-unit.source: Accounts and Billing in Azure SQL Database
trans-unit.target: Accounts and Billing in Azure SQL Database

trans-unit.source: Notes
trans-unit.target: Notes

trans-unit.source: When you create a new Azure SQL Server and Database, Azure Services is automatically enabled. The BizTalk Service requires Azure Services be enabled.
trans-unit.target: When you create a new Azure SQL Server and Database, Azure Services is automatically enabled. The BizTalk Service requires Azure Services be enabled.

trans-unit.source: If you create a new Azure SQL Database on an existing Azure SQL Server, the firewall rules of the Server are not changed. As a result, it's possible other Azure Services are not allowed access to the Server's databases.
trans-unit.target: If you create a new Azure SQL Database on an existing Azure SQL Server, the firewall rules of the Server are not changed. As a result, it's possible other Azure Services are not allowed access to the Server's databases.

trans-unit.source: Azure Access Control namespace
trans-unit.target: Azure Access Control namespace

trans-unit.source: Authenticates with Azure BizTalk Services. When you deploy a BizTalk Service project from Visual Studio, you enter this Access Control namespace. When you create a BizTalk Service, the Access Control namespace is automatically created.
trans-unit.target: Authenticates with Azure BizTalk Services. When you deploy a BizTalk Service project from Visual Studio, you enter this Access Control namespace. When you create a BizTalk Service, the Access Control namespace is automatically created.

trans-unit.source: Azure Storage account
trans-unit.target: Azure Storage account

trans-unit.source: Gives access to tables, blobs, and queues used by your BizTalk Service to save the following:
trans-unit.target: Gives access to tables, blobs, and queues used by your BizTalk Service to save the following:

trans-unit.source: Log files that monitor the BizTalk Service. The monitoring output is also displayed in the **Monitoring** tab in the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: Log files that monitor the BizTalk Service. The monitoring output is also displayed in the **Monitoring** tab in the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: When creating an X12 or AS2 agreement between partners, you can enable the Archiving feature to store message properties. This data is saved in the Storage account.
trans-unit.target: When creating an X12 or AS2 agreement between partners, you can enable the Archiving feature to store message properties. This data is saved in the Storage account.

trans-unit.source: When you create a BizTalk Service, you can use an existing Storage account or automatically create a new Storage account.
trans-unit.target: When you create a BizTalk Service, you can use an existing Storage account or automatically create a new Storage account.

trans-unit.source: The default Storage settings are sufficient for a BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: The default Storage settings are sufficient for a BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: When you create a Storage account, a Primary Key and Secondary Key are automatically created. These Keys control access to your Storage account. The BizTalk Service automatically uses the Primary Key.
trans-unit.target: When you create a Storage account, a Primary Key and Secondary Key are automatically created. These Keys control access to your Storage account. The BizTalk Service automatically uses the Primary Key.

trans-unit.source: See
trans-unit.target: See

trans-unit.source: Storage
trans-unit.target: Storage

trans-unit.source: for more information.
trans-unit.target: for more information.

trans-unit.source: SSL private certificate
trans-unit.target: SSL private certificate

trans-unit.source: When an Azure BizTalk Service is created, an HTTPS URL that includes your BizTalk Service name is also created. This URL is automatically configured to use a self-signed development-only certificate. For production, you need a private SSL certificate.
trans-unit.target: When an Azure BizTalk Service is created, an HTTPS URL that includes your BizTalk Service name is also created. This URL is automatically configured to use a self-signed development-only certificate. For production, you need a private SSL certificate.

trans-unit.source: Important SSL Certificate Information
trans-unit.target: Important SSL Certificate Information

trans-unit.source: The certificate expiration date must be less than 5 years.
trans-unit.target: The certificate expiration date must be less than 5 years.

trans-unit.source: All private certificates require a password. Know this password and as a best practice, share this password with your administrators.
trans-unit.target: All private certificates require a password. Know this password and as a best practice, share this password with your administrators.

trans-unit.source: Self-signed certificates are used in a test/development environment. When using self-signed certificates, import the certificate to your Personal certificate store and the Trusted Root Certification Authorities certificate store.
trans-unit.target: Self-signed certificates are used in a test/development environment. When using self-signed certificates, import the certificate to your Personal certificate store and the Trusted Root Certification Authorities certificate store.

trans-unit.source: When sending the production certificate request to your certification authority, give the following certificate properties:
trans-unit.target: When sending the production certificate request to your certification authority, give the following certificate properties:

trans-unit.source: Enhanced Key Usage
trans-unit.target: Enhanced Key Usage

trans-unit.source: : At a minimum, Azure BizTalk Services requires Server Authentication.
trans-unit.target: : At a minimum, Azure BizTalk Services requires Server Authentication.

trans-unit.source: Common Name
trans-unit.target: Common Name

trans-unit.source: : Enter the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of your Azure BizTalk Service URL. See
trans-unit.target: : Enter the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of your Azure BizTalk Service URL. See

trans-unit.source: Create a BizTalk Service
trans-unit.target: Create a BizTalk Service

trans-unit.source: in this article.
trans-unit.target: in this article.

trans-unit.source: A new or different certificate can be added after the BizTalk Service is created.
trans-unit.target: A new or different certificate can be added after the BizTalk Service is created.

trans-unit.source: When you create an Azure BizTalk Service, the Hybrid Connections tab is available:
trans-unit.target: When you create an Azure BizTalk Service, the Hybrid Connections tab is available:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Hybrid Connections Tab</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Hybrid Connections Tab</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Hybrid Connections are used to connect an Azure website or Azure mobile service to any on-premises resource that uses a static TCP port, such as SQL Server, MySQL, HTTP Web APIs, Mobile Services, and most custom Web Services.
trans-unit.target: Hybrid Connections are used to connect an Azure website or Azure mobile service to any on-premises resource that uses a static TCP port, such as SQL Server, MySQL, HTTP Web APIs, Mobile Services, and most custom Web Services.

trans-unit.source: Hybrid Connections and the BizTalk Adapter Service are different.
trans-unit.target: Hybrid Connections and the BizTalk Adapter Service are different.

trans-unit.source: The BizTalk Adapter Service is used to connect Azure BizTalk Services to an on-premises Line of Business (LOB) system.
trans-unit.target: The BizTalk Adapter Service is used to connect Azure BizTalk Services to an on-premises Line of Business (LOB) system.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Hybrid Connections</linkText><title></title> to learn more, including creating and managing Hybrid Connections.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Hybrid Connections</linkText><title></title> to learn more, including creating and managing Hybrid Connections.

trans-unit.source: Now that a BizTalk Service is created, familiarize yourself with the different <linkText>BizTalk Services: Dashboard, Monitor and Scale tabs</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Now that a BizTalk Service is created, familiarize yourself with the different <linkText>BizTalk Services: Dashboard, Monitor and Scale tabs</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Your BizTalk Service is ready for your applications.
trans-unit.target: Your BizTalk Service is ready for your applications.

trans-unit.source: To start creating applications, go to <linkText>Azure BizTalk Services</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: To start creating applications, go to <linkText>Azure BizTalk Services</linkText><title></title>.
